article.headline: Virgin Galactic poaches Disney international parks head as next CEO
article.body: Virgin Galactic Holdings Inc. SPCE, -3.12% shares rose Wednesday after the space travel company said it poached a Walt Disney Co. DIS, +1.53% exec to serve as its chief executive. Virgin Galactic shares rose 4.6% in after-hours activity, following a 0.7% rise to close at $18.55 in the regular session. Late Wednesday, Virgin Galactic said it appointed Michael Colglazier as its new CEO, effective July 20. At Disney, Colglazier last served as president and managing director of the company's international parks division that includes Disneyland Paris, Hong Kong Disneyland, Shanghai Disney Resort and Tokyo Disney Resort with the Oriental Land Co. Colglazier will also join Virgin Galactic's board on July 20. Virgin Galactic said its first CEO, George Whitesides, will begin serving as Chief Space Officer when Colglazier joins.
